idlastro/

ftdelcol.pro


top source ftdelcol

ftdelcol, h, tab, name

NAME: FTDELCOL PURPOSE: Delete a column of data from a FITS table

CALLING SEQUENCE: ftdelcol, h, tab, name

INPUTS-OUPUTS h,tab - FITS table header and data array. H and TAB will be updated with the specified column deleted

INPUTS: name - Either (1) a string giving the name of the column to delete or (2) a scalar giving the column number to delete

EXAMPLE: Suppose it has been determined that the F7.2 format used for a field FLUX in a FITS table is insufficient. The old column must first be deleted before a new column can be written with a new format.

flux = FTGET(h,tab,'FLUX') ;Save the existing values FTDELCOL,h,tab,'FLUX' ;Delete the existing column FTADDCOL,h,tab,'FLUX',8,'F9.2' ;Create a new column with larger format FTPUT,h,tab,'FLUX',0,flux ;Put back the original values

REVISION HISTORY: Written W. Landsman STX Co. August, 1988 Adapted for IDL Version 2, J. Isensee, July, 1990 Converted to IDL V5.0 W. Landsman September 1997 Updated call to new FTINFO W. Landsman May 2000

Parameters

h
tab
name
